result.execSummary:
The defendant Laville D Russell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Laville D Russell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Laville D Russell was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 4 days served, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Sex assault treatment & offender rules.  Go to planned parenthood for educational program.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes and stays sentence of 9 months jail; deft placed on probation for 1 year wconditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge, bond applied to costs; credit for 4 days served if revoked.  Deft is not eligible for expunction.
